content.p: For students showing strong academic ability who have overcome significant obstacles to their academic progression Nottingham alumnus Andrew Halford generously established this major award for undergraduate students entering the University from 2016 onwards. Andrew is an Industrial Economics graduate (1980). In 2024 the Award offers financial support of £7,500 per year over the ordinary duration of their course to one student. The student will be academically able and aspire to a university education despite circumstances which would ordinarily prevent them from achieving this. The successful applicant will receive between £22,500 to £37,500 depending on their course duration. This is a pre-entry award, meaning applicants will need to apply prior to starting their course in the 2024/25 academic year.* This fund is now closed. These are the same criteria as apply to eligibility for home funding from Student Finance. If you have any questions please contact us by emailing bursaries@nottingham.ac.uk or by calling us on 01158232071 and asking for John Hudson, Claire Lowe or Alison Hickling.
